value.title: Easily convert your Excel Power Pivot model to Power BI
value.excerpt: Take your Power Pivot model in Excel and easily convert it to Power BI in just a few steps. Patrick looks at a few different ways to do this.  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level? We have training courses available

value.title: Expand lists in Power BI (also a look at M Syntax)
value.excerpt: I show how you can take a table that lists "Record" and expand that within Power BI. This also works with Power Query. I have a look at the M Syntax and show a cleaner approach.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Gen2
value.excerpt: At Microsoft Ignite, we found out about Power BI Premium Gen2. It's now available for you to use and WOW! It has changed the game! Adam walks you through what the changes are to help you level up.  Docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-what-is#power-bi-premium-generation-2-preview

value.title: Introducing Power BI Premium Per User (Preview)
value.excerpt: Are you curious what Power BI Premium Per User is all about? Adam walks you through how to get it and what it means from a user experience. Take advantage of Power BI Premium features without the Premium capacity price!  Announcement Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-premium-per-user-public-preview-now-available/

value.title: Power BI and the On-premises Data Gateway: What is it?
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at the On-Premises Data Gateway. What is it exactly? This can be used with more than just Power BI. This includes PowerApps, Microsoft Flow, Azure Analysis Services and more. The entire Power Platform!   If you found this video helpful, we have a free cheat sheet for you for more

value.title: Power BI for the NON-TECHnical person
value.excerpt: Is Power BI intimidating? Coming from Microsoft Excel? You consider yourself non-technical? Don't want to have to write or know anything about DAX? Patrick looks at how you can create a report quickly with just your Excel data and not have to write any code!  📢 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Data source, Dataset and parameters
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Patrick walks you through how to get started with a paginated report using Report Builder. In this video, he starts off with how to create an embedded data source, a dataset, and parameters.  To download Report Builder, check out this link: https://guyinacu.be/reportbuilder

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:

value.title: Power BI query reduction when using DirectQuery
value.excerpt: Using DirectQuery in Power BI? Things slowing down and you want to make interactions snappier? Patrick looks how you can change a few settings to take the experience within Power BI to the next level!  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://www.facebook.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Tutorial: Sort By A Measure Not Shown In Visual
value.excerpt: In this Power BI tutorial, Patrick shows you how you can sort by a measure not show in a visual within Power BI Desktop. This was something we didn't even know about until recently and it a great little Power BI nugget. If you wanted to sort by something not shown in a visual, this video is for you!

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/

value.title: Advanced Power BI Bookmark Options (Data/Display/Current Page)
value.excerpt: If you use Power BI Bookmarks you may not have used the advanced bookmarking options for  ➔ Bookmark Data ➔ Bookmark Display  ➔ Bookmark Current Page I talk about these options and show you were these can really help you out when using Power BI Bookmarks in advanced scenarios.  ================================

value.title: DAX Measures: Filter Context Explained in Simple Terms using the I.C.A.N. Principle
value.excerpt: For Power BI DAX Measures, one of the hardest concepts to grasp is the Filter Context. Or is it? I explain the “Filter Context” using the 4-easy step approach of the I.C.A.N. Principle. ==  I. Incoming Filters ==  C. CALCULATE does it’s Magic! ==  A. Apply relationships (filters flow Across relationships)

value.title: Power BI Hyperlink Icons! Make Your HTML Links Look Pretty 🦋
value.excerpt: Using HTML or URL Links in your reports can be really powerful. But these can sometimes look ugly (e.g. for long URLs). Learn how you can pretty up your reports by using a URL Icon instead.  ================================ 👉 FREE Power BI Step-by-Step Tutorial http://web.learnpowerbi.com/tutorial 👉
